title: Under California Commercial Code 3419(e) does an accommodation party have to pay off the debt in order to enforce the loan?
question: I am a cosigner that is making payments on a loan because the debtor has stopped making payments. Can I get a default judgment against the debtor?
answers:
Great question. I am not a California attorney, but in general your issue has to do with your right of subrogation as guarantor. I suggest you consult with a California commercial litigator to see what the loan documents provide and in particular whether they purport to provide a waiver of the right of subrogation, and if so whether that right is indeed waivable under California law.

If you do not have a California attorney, I would be happy to make a referral.
